content.shortDescription: When all but one child from the same class mysteriously vanish on the same night at exactly the same time, a community is left questioning who or what is behind their disappearance.
content.title: Weapons

textRecommendations.headline: Weapons has everything a great horror movie should have
textRecommendations.body: Weapons makes you feel excited about watching movies again. It’s an elevated horror movie without ever being pretentious, and it has everything a good horror movie should have; it’s loaded with surprises, true terror, and genuine shock. It also has some great laughs, which work well to balance out the horror.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Weapons makes you feel excited about watching movies again. It’s an elevated horror movie without ever being pretentious, and it has everything a good horror movie should have; it’s loaded with surprises, true terror, and genuine shock. It also has some great laughs, which work well to balance out the horror.

profile.bio: After guest starring in series such as “SEAL Team” (2019), “The Morning Show” (2019), “You Are Who You Are” (2019), and “9-1-1” (2022), Clayton Farris has become a known quantity on the small screen. He has since starred in major movies such as “MaXXXine” (2024) and “Weapons” (2025), where he has played opposite the likes of Josh Brolin, Mia Goth, Julia Garner, and Alden Ehrenreich. He is the star of multiple short films and has been featured in a series of different podcasts. Furthermore, he is a multi-talented writer, producer, and actor who works prolifically across all mediums.

textRecommendations.headline: A dark masterpiece about trauma with some unexpected laughs
textRecommendations.body: Weapons is a dark masterpiece that’s split into chapters, and despite being a horror movie, you’re going to laugh way more than you expect. It truly has a great story and is super fun to watch, especially in theaters. It’s loaded with so much emotion, so I think audiences are going to have a great time. But beneath it all, there’s lots of trauma and manipulation that really drive the horror throughout it all.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Weapons is a dark masterpiece that’s split into chapters, and despite being a horror movie, you’re going to laugh way more than you expect. It truly has a great story and is super fun to watch, especially in theaters. It’s loaded with so much emotion, so I think audiences are going to have a great time. But beneath it all, there’s lots of trauma and manipulation that really drive the horror throughout it all.

profile.bio: Callie Schuttera landed on the scene after her incredible performance in the multi-award-winning indie movie “Blue” (2018), which she also co-wrote. She is a regular guest on multiple podcasts, including “Roanoke Falls” (2021–2024), executive produced by John Carpenter. She has starred in TV shows such as “The Rookie” (2025) and “On Call” (2025) and features alongside Josh Brolin and Julia Garner in “Weapons” (2025). Furthermore, she is co-founder of Poison Pictures Film House, where she, along with her wife Gabriela Ledesma, helps produce independent movies, music videos, documentaries, and commercials.
